column4: i just bought a new AMD64 machine and i've got problems installing linux (amd64 bits versions of course)
CPU 0: Machine Check Exception: 4 Bank 4: b200000000070f0f
Kernel Panic - not syncing: Machine check
given a certain pint, it hangs up with that
i think i have to disable the 'mce'
i think i have to disable the 'mce' at the booting process of the installation, but i write 'linux nomce' and it keeps happening
I'm not sure you can turn off MCE like that, and generally it indicates a fault with the system
does your machine run a 'memtest' okay? (and does the 386 linux have a problem booting)
the memtest didn't find any error
hmm, which amd64 cpu is it?
and, i've been unable to boot a 386 kernel. I'm new to 64 bits, is that even possible?
yeah, I'm using a 32-bit linux with a K7 kernel here atm, it saves hassle with things like flash and w32codecs
it can be a possible solution to use a 32-bit linux, is it easy to do so?
